goal_summary: Execute 10 tasks from TASK_QUEUE.json: fix Windows make help, resolve uv permission issues, persist on-demand forecasts, wire UI to use run_id, add /risk endpoint, add export fires button, implement async export worker, extend CI for ml/ingest, document forecast workflow, and remove hardcoded debug log path.

tasks.title: Make help target portable for Windows
tasks.description: Replace grep+awk in Makefile help target (line 18) with a portable Python one-liner that parses ## comments and prints targets.
acceptance: make help succeeds on Windows PowerShell
Output lists at least: install, dev-api, dev-ui, test, lint
verification: Would run: make help
notes: worker: Replaced grep+awk in Makefile help target with portable Python one-liner. Changed PYTHON default from 'python' to 'python3' for better cross-platform compatibility.

tasks.title: Fix uv Windows permission failure in UI venv
tasks.description: Resolve 'Access is denied' error when uv tries to remove ui/.venv/lib64 on Windows. Likely a stale symlink issue; add deterministic cleanup or workaround.
acceptance: make lint completes without uv permission error
make test completes without uv permission error
verification: Would run: make lint
Would run: make test
notes: worker: Fixed Windows uv permission error by adding deterministic cleanup of ui/.venv/lib64 symlink before lint and test commands. Extended scripts/clean.py to remove .venv directories.

tasks.title: Persist on-demand forecasts from POST /forecast/generate
tasks.description: Modify POST /forecast/generate to create a run record, persist contours (and optionally rasters), and return non-null run.id. Reuse existing persistence logic from ingest/spread_forecast.py.
acceptance: POST /forecast/generate returns non-null run.id
Contour tiles retrievable via /tiles/forecast_contours?run_id=<ID>
verification: Would run: cd api && uv run pytest
Would run: curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:8000/forecast/generate ... (expect non-null run.id)
notes: worker: Modified POST /forecast/generate to create run record, persist rasters and contours, and return non-null run.id. Reused persistence logic from ingest/spread_forecast.py and ingest/spread_repository.py. Added HTTPException for missing region_name. Added test to verify persistence behavior.

tasks.title: UI: use generated forecast run_id for overlay
tasks.description: Wire UI so that after calling POST /forecast/generate, the returned run.id is stored in session state and used to build forecast contour tile URL.
acceptance: Overlay updates immediately after forecast generation
Tile requests include run_id= parameter
verification: Would run: make dev-api && make dev-ui
Manual: click Generate Spread Forecast, confirm overlay appears and requests include run_id=

UI Risk index toggle renders layer labeled as baseline
verification: Would run: make lint
Would run: make test

tasks.title: UI: add Export fires download button
tasks.description: Add UI button/link that calls existing GET /fires/export with current bbox/time filters. Use API_PUBLIC_BASE_URL so download URL is browser-accessible.
acceptance: Clicking Export fires downloads a file
Downloaded file matches current bbox/time filters
verification: Would run: make dev-ui

tasks.title: Implement real async export worker
tasks.description: Implement actual export logic in api/exports/worker.py for at least fires_csv kind. Remove TODO placeholder, write file artifact, update export_jobs.result so download works.
acceptance: One async export job (fires_csv) completes end-to-end
Job transitions queued->running->succeeded and download works
verification: Would run: docker compose up --build
Create export job via API, observe job succeeds, download file
notes: worker: Implemented fires_csv async export worker that fetches fire detections, writes CSV file, and updates job result for download.
